opennlp.ccg.alignment
Class MappingFormat

java.lang.Object
  java.text.Format
      opennlp.ccg.alignment.MappingFormat
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class MappingFormat
extends Format

A class for formatting mappings according to an encoding scheme and a specified set of formatting fields. This class extends Format so that it fits in with the Java text parsing API.

Care is always taken to translate a mapping's phrase number and indices to the target encoding scheme's index base. If a mapping format is not strict, parsing is handled robustly in that it tolerates fields that are optional and may not always be specified. On output, a non-strict mapping format will only include fields that either (1) do not have a default value, or (2) have a value different from the default. Strict mapping formats, on the other hand, always expect and generate all and only the fields specified.

Instances of mapping formats can be obtained by calling one of the getInstance(...) methods.

Author:
Scott Martin
See Also:
getFields(), isStrict(), EncodingScheme, IndexBase, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

MappingFormat

protected MappingFormat(EncodingScheme scheme,
                        Set<MappingFormat.Field> fields,
                        boolean strict)
Creates a mapping format based on the given encoding scheme and fields. The boolean flag tells instances whether or not to output values when they are the default, or expect them during parsing.

Parameters:
scheme - The encoding scheme to create a formatter/parser for.
fields - The fields to include.
strict - Whether or not to use/expect default values in formatting and parsing.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If scheme or fields is null, or if the specified set of fields does not contain all of the required fields of the specified scheme.
See Also:
MappingFormat.Field.hasDefaultValue()
Method Detail

getInstance

public static MappingFormat getInstance(EncodingScheme scheme)
Gets an instance of a mapping formatter/parser for a given encoding scheme with the scheme's default fields as the specified fields.

See Also:
getInstance(EncodingScheme, Set)

getInstance

public static MappingFormat getInstance(EncodingScheme scheme,
                                        Set<MappingFormat.Field> fields)
Gets an instance of a mapping formatter/parser for a given encoding scheme and field set.

See Also:
getInstance(EncodingScheme, Set, boolean), Alignments.DEFAULT_STRICTNESS

getInstance

public static MappingFormat getInstance(EncodingScheme scheme,
                                        Set<MappingFormat.Field> fields,
                                        boolean strict)
Gets an instance of a mapping formatter/parser for a given encoding scheme and field set. The returned instances are cached to avoid creating multiple copies with the same scheme, fields, and strictness flag. Cache access is synchronized to avoid threading issues.

Parameters:
scheme - The scheme to create a formatter/parser for.
fields - The fields to include in the parser/formatter.
strict - Whether the returned format should be strict.
Returns:
A new formatter/parser for mappings that will expect mappings encoded per the specified scheme and will format mappings to strings of that encoding scheme.

getEncodingScheme

public EncodingScheme getEncodingScheme()
Gets the encoding scheme used by this mapping formatter/parser.

Returns:
The encoding scheme used to create this instance.
See Also:
getInstance(EncodingScheme)

getFields

public Set<MappingFormat.Field> getFields()
Gets the field set used by this mapping formatter/parser.

See Also:
getInstance(EncodingScheme)

isStrict

public boolean isStrict()
Tests whether this mapping format will output default values, or expect them during parsing. If true, this format will output and parse for every specified field. Otherwise, this format will only write/expect fields that have a default value if their value differs from the default.

See Also:
MappingFormat.Field.hasDefaultValue()

formatMapping

public String formatMapping(Mapping mapping)
Formats a mapping according to the encoding scheme in effect.

Parameters:
mapping - The mapping to format.
Returns:
A string in the format required by this formatter/parser's getEncodingScheme().
See Also:

format(Mapping, StringBuffer, FieldPosition)

format

public StringBuffer format(Mapping mapping,
                           StringBuffer toAppendTo,
                           FieldPosition pos)
Formats a given Mapping based on the specified field position, appending the output to the string buffer provided.

Parameters:
mapping - The mapping to format.
toAppendTo - The string buffer to append to.
pos - The field position to use.
Returns:
A string buffer with the information from mapping corresponding to the field position pos appended to the one provided.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - For the following reasons:
  • An attempt is made to format an alignment with a null index.
  • The value of pos.getFieldAttribute() is not an instance of MappingFormat.Field.
  • The encoding scheme does not contain the field specified by pos.
  • The specified list of fields does not contain the field specified by pos.
  • Either a field required by the encoding scheme or the field specified by pos has a null value.

parseMapping

public Mapping parseMapping(String source)
                     throws ParseException
Parses a Mapping from a given string, based on the encoding scheme in effect.

Parameters:
source - The string to parse.
Returns:
A mapping object representing the specified string.
Throws:
ParseException - If the string is ill-formed according to this formatter/parser's encoding scheme. The exception thrown will contain an error offset reflecting the position in the string where the parse error occurred, if possible.

parseObject

                          ParsePosition pos)
Overrides the Format.parseObject(String, ParsePosition) method to return a mapping, parsing from the specified ParsePosition.

parseObject in class Format
